sn3.10:1.1: Now on that occasion a great mass of people had been put in bondage by King Pasenadi of Kosala—some with ropes, some with clogs, some with chains.
sn3.10:2.1: Then, in the morning, a number of bhikkhus dressed and, taking their bowls and robes, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
sn3.10:2.2: When they had walked for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from their alms round, after the meal they approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, sat down to one side, and said:
sn3.10:2.3: “Here, venerable sir, a great mass of people have been put in bondage by King Pasenadi of Kosala, some with ropes, some with clogs, some with chains. ”
sn3.10:3.1: Then the Blessed One, having understood the meaning of this, on that occasion recited these verses:
sn3.10:4.1: “That bond, the wise say, is not strong
sn3.10:4.2: Made of iron, wood, or rope;
sn3.10:4.3: But infatuation with jewellery and earrings,
sn3.10:4.4: Anxious concern for wives and children—
sn3.10:5.1: This, the wise say, is the strong bond,
sn3.10:5.3: But even this they cut and wander forth,
